pr_title: [no ticket][risk=no] Allow RDR export cron failures to throw a server error

timeline.message: Return a 500 response code if any part of RDR export task creation fails.

timeline.bodyText: In a controller you might want to throw a more specific error here and let the handler translate it into a 500, but I'm not sure if that happens with crons. This is fine.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: If you use this constructor that takes the throwable itself, you keep the stack trace.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: drive-by nit: Above, I'd declare a TaskBuilder and then use taskBuilder.build() in the cal to createTask(). Or just inline the builder.
timeline.author: jaycarlton
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -127,8 +134,10 @@ private void createAndPushTask(List<Long> ids, String queuePath, String taskUri)
     } catch (IOException ex) {

timeline.bodyText: So we need to trigger an alert on the tasks failing in the queue. I bet I can get that from logs somewhere, assuming the tasks live in our GCP-space.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: Yes – this will be an important metric to track & alert on too.
replies.author: gjuggler

timeline.bodyText: nit: Should the IDs be a Set? Alternatively, just take in a Collection<Long>.
timeline.author: jaycarlton
